HeadedTable A table with headings for each column.

Gary Polhill

Constructor Detail

HeadedTable

public HeadedTable(int rows,
                   java.lang.String[] colHeadings)
Build a HeadedTable. The number of column headings is assumed to be the same as the number of columns.

Parameters:
rows - The number of rows
colHeadings - The column headings

HeadedTable

public HeadedTable(Table<T> table)
Build a HeadedTable from an existing table using default column names. These are as commonly used in spreadsheet applications, but without limitations on column numbers: the letters A-Z for columns 1-26, then AA-AZ for 27-52, then BA-BZ, ... ZZ-AZ, AAA-AAZ, ... AAAA-AAAZ, ... etc.

Parameters:
table - The existing table.
Method Detail

initCol2Ix

private void initCol2Ix()
Initialise the col2ix map

getColumnHeadingsSet

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getColumnHeadingsSet()
Get the column headings as a Set. Will throw an IllegalStateException if the column headings contain a repeated element (i.e. a column heading is used more than once).

Returns:
The column headings

getColumnHeadings

public java.lang.String[] getColumnHeadings()

Returns:
The column headings

atRC

public T atRC(int row,
              java.lang.String colHeading)
Get the entry at the specified row with the given column heading. This method will throw an IllegalArgumentException if the column heading is not recognised.

Parameters:
row - The row number
colHeading - The column heading
Returns:
The entry

findRow

public int findRow(java.lang.String colHeading,
                   T value)
Find the first row where the column headed colHeading has value value

Parameters:
colHeading - The heading of the column in which to search
value - The value to look for
Returns:
The first row having the value in that column, or -1 if not found.

findRow

public int findRow(int startRow,
                   java.lang.String colHeading,
                   T value)
Find the first row starting at startRow where the column headed colHeading has value value

Parameters:
startRow - The first row at which to start searching
colHeading - The heading of the column in which to search
value - The value to look for
Returns:
The row, or -1 if the value isn't found

atRC

public void atRC(int row,
                 java.lang.String colHeading,
                 T entry)
Set the entry at the specified row with the given column heading. This method will throw an IllegalArgumentException if the column heading is not recognised.

Parameters:
row - The row number
colHeading - The column heading
entry - The entry

getData

public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,T>> getData()
Get the whole table as an ArrayList of maps of column heading to entry.

Returns:
All the data in the table
